result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall R. Baughman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Illegal Shining of Deer, Elk, or Bear [Modifiers: PTAC - DNR], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 29.314(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Randall R. Baughman in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.  Plea of guilty.   Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders a $1,000.00 fine plus court costs; DNA surcharge; revocation of all chapter 29 privileges for three years and prohibited from issuance of any new approval under chapter 29 for three years.  The fine and costs are to be paid at the rate of $150.00 a month beginning May 8, 2015.    Appeal rights given to defendant. The spotlight and gun are to be seized but do not indicate on judgment of conviction as it is not defendants.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Randall R. Baughman in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs defendant of right to an attorney.  Court enters a plea of not guilty to all charges.   Court orders a $500.00 signature bond and booking  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.  - rt
*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.
